p: In conclusion, renal carcinomas are mostly not caused by BRAF‐mutation. Thus, tubular and pelvic carcinomas of the kidney cannot be detected by BRAF‐mutation analysis of cells excreted within urine. In contrast, BRAF‐mutation is often involved in pathogenesis of TCC in urinary bladder and/or urethra, and can be used as an excellent diagnostic tool with enormous specify for malignancy and site of carcinomas in lower urinary tract.
